postcard.opening: Postcard sent 22nd July 2022 by Benjamin Hill to his Victoria Cook, Nottingham.

postcard.opening: Postcard from 18/02/2023 by Nicole Bell to Samuel Ward, Southampton.

postcard.opening: Postcard from Laura Cooper, 10-Nov-2020 to Henry Evans, Oxford.

postcard.opening: Postcard sent 12 May 2023 by Jason Morris to his Rebecca Parker, Cambridge.

postcard.opening: Postcard from 15/03/2022 by Anna Foster to Paul Hughes, York.

postcard.opening: Postcard mailed Jan 5, 2024 from Brian Nelson to Karen Carter, Plymouth.
postcard.message: Karen, the pyramids are even more impressive in person! The heat takes getting used to though. Cheers, Brian.

postcard.opening: Postcard from Christine Mitchell, dated 10 Dec 2021 to Steven Collins, Norwich.

postcard.opening: Postcard sent on 08-Aug-2022 by Patrick Stewart to his Janet Price, Brighton.

postcard.opening: Postcard from 28 Feb 2023 by Emma Richardson to Mark Bennett, Belfast.
postcard.message: Mark, the Burj Khalifa is even taller than I imagined! The view is worth the elevator ride. Warm wishes, Emma.

postcard.opening: Postcard mailed on 1-Dec-2023 from Rachel Green to All Staff, Plymouth.
postcard.message: Annual strategy retreat productive - exciting plans for Q1! Detailed memo coming Friday. - RG

postcard.opening: Correspondence dated 03/11/22 from Mr. Albert Graves to St. Mary's Alumni Association, York.
postcard.message: I passed by our old school today. The chalkboards still bear fragments of lessons from that final June. The swings creak like ghosts of children's laughter. Fifty years vanish in the dust motes dancing through broken windows. With heavy regards, Albert

postcard.opening: Note written 14-Mar-2023 by Mrs. Eunice Parker addressed to Animal Memorial Clinic, Norwich.
postcard.message: Thank you for your kindness when we said goodbye to Max last Tuesday. His water bowl still sits by the door. The silence is louder than his barking ever was. The leash hangs unused, still shaped by his eager tugs. Gratefully yours, Eunice Parker

postcard.opening: Memorandum from Jan 5, 2024 sender Librarian G. Wilkins to County Council, Leeds.
postcard.message: Today we boxed the last children's books. The storytime carpet bears permanent indentations from decades of tiny listeners. Without funding, this sanctuary of imagination becomes another casualty of "progress." With professional disappointment, G. Wilkins

postcard.opening: Dispatch dated 30.05.2022 from Captain R. Donovan (Ret.) to 8th Battalion Veterans, Plymouth.
postcard.message: Another Memorial Day passes. The photo of our platoon grows more yellow each year. So many faces now only exist in this fading image. The living grow fewer while the ghosts multiply. In solemn remembrance, Capt. Donovan

postcard.opening: Message postmarked 24-Dec-23 sender Mr. H. Goldberg to Whittaker & Sons, Creditors Dept..
postcard.message: Today I turned the key for the final time. Sixty-three years of childhood wonder reduced to liquidation stickers. The train set still circles emptily in the display window. No children came for our last Christmas. Regretfully submitted, H. Goldberg

postcard.opening: Correspondence dated 15th Sept 2022 from Nurse A. Bennett to Maplewood Staff, Brighton.
postcard.message: Mrs. Whitaker passed quietly last night. The piano sits unplayed now. No more Chopin drifting through the halls at teatime. Her room already smells of disinfectant instead of lavender. With professional sympathy, Nurse Bennett

postcard.opening: Letter composed July 1, 2023 by Editor T. Reeves to Printing Press Museum, Dublin.
postcard.message: The newsroom is silent now. The typewriters we donated gather dust behind glass. No more clatter of deadlines, no ink-stained fingers. The digital world has no need for our obsolete passion. With journalistic respect, T. Reeves

postcard.opening: Report filed 08/10/22 from Coast Guard Officer M. Evans to Maritime Archives, Southampton.
postcard.message: The lifeboat returned alone today. We recovered no survivors this time. The harbor bells tolled seventeen times - once for each soul lost to the storm's hunger. With professional sorrow, Officer Evans

postcard.opening: Memorandum dated 18-Apr-2023 from Dr. L. Chen to Health Authority, Birmingham.
postcard.message: Pediatrics Wing officially closed today. The mural of jungle animals seems to weep under peeling paint. Tiny handprints still mark the windows where children pressed against glass, watching birds we promised would mean spring's arrival. With medical concern, Dr. Chen

postcard.opening: Note written 28 Feb 2023 by Groundskeeper J. O'Reilly to Botanical Society, Glasgow.
postcard.message: The last orchid died yesterday. Broken glass litters the greenhouse floor like artificial rain. Forty years of cultivation surrendered to budget cuts. The heating system's final gasp sounded like a sigh. With horticultural regret, J. O'Reilly

postcard.opening: Dispatch dated 10/01/24 from Chief W. Peterson to Station 17 Alumni, Nottingham.
postcard.message: Old Engine 42 went to the scrapyard today. Its ladder still bears scars from the Harrison Street fire. The new trucks shine with technology but lack the soul of this warhorse that saved 143 lives. With firefighting pride, Chief Peterson

postcard.opening: Court record 15 June 2022 from Bailiff R. Johnson to County Courthouse, Staff Records.
postcard.message: Judge Callahan's courtroom sat empty today. The verdict book closed for the final time. After 42 years, even the scales of justice grow too heavy to lift. The gavel's echo fades. With judicial respect, R. Johnson

postcard.opening: Parish notice 03-Sep-2023 from Vicar E. Thompson to Diocesan Office, Canterbury.
postcard.message: The bell tower stands mute after structural condemnation. Six centuries of summoning the faithful ended by rusted ironwork. The pigeons seem confused by the unnatural silence at noon. With spiritual concern, Vicar Thompson

postcard.opening: Written 15th of January, 2023 by Your son Amir to Dear Family, Dhaka, Bangladesh.
postcard.message: Today I saw snow for the first time! It felt like magic dust covering Toronto. I tried making a snowball like in movies but my hands turned red from cold. The grocery store cashier laughed when I bought milk and bread like everyone warned. Baba, I wish you could see how trees become ice sculptures here. Missing home warmth, Amir

postcard.opening: Sent 03-May-2022 from Carlos to Mamá y Hermanos, Guadalajara, Mexico.
postcard.message: First paycheck came today. Enclosed is $200 - please use half for Miguel's medicine. The factory is loud like home during carnival, but without music or joy. I share a room with 3 others above a laundromat. Strange to wash clothes while sleeping, no? At night we tell stories about Jalisco to remember. Con amor, Carlitos

postcard.opening: Dated 10/06/2023 by Fatima to My Beloved Parents, Lagos, Nigeria.
postcard.message: I DID IT! The nursing license arrived today. All those nights studying while cleaning hospital floors were worth it. When the director called me "Dr. Adebayo" I cried like a baby. Please tell Grandma I kept my promise. Next goal: bringing you here for graduation ceremony! Your daughter, Fatima

postcard.opening: Composed 12 Sept 2022 from Wei to Mother, Shenzhen, China.
postcard.message: The apartment echoes without your scolding voice, Mama. I burned the rice again today. No one tells me to wear thicker socks. Canadian people are kind but their smiles don't reach eyes like yours. The moon looks same here though - we still share that. Lonely, Xiao Wei

postcard.opening: Mailed 30-Nov-23 by Jorge to Querida Familia, Caracas, Venezuela.
postcard.message: After 3 years, my residency came through! No more hiding from la migra. Celebrate with arepas for me! I got construction supervisor job - hard hat has my name spelled right. Next step: saving for your visas. The struggle wasn't for nothing. Esperándolos, Jorge

postcard.opening: Written Feb 14, 2024 from Your Anna to Babushka, Kyiv, Ukraine.
postcard.message: The baby came early but healthy - 2.8 kg! They let me name her Liliya after you. American doctors are confused why I cry when hearing Ukrainian lullabies. She has your nose, Babushka. When war ends, we'll picnic at Trubayiv Forest like before. Your granddaughter, Annushka

postcard.opening: Sent 07/07/2022 by Ahmed to Brothers, Aleppo, Syria.
postcard.message: The Halal food package arrived today - first proper hummus in 6 months! I ate the whole container remembering Mama's recipe. Found a mosque where people speak Arabic. They say Germany gets easier after first winter. The cold enters bones here but at least no bombs. Stay safe, Ahmed

postcard.opening: Dated 22-Mar-2023 from Rosa to Papá, Managua, Nicaragua.
postcard.message: $500 sent today - tear down that zinc roof before rainy season! I work two cleaning jobs but never as hard as you in fields. The señora's kids call me "nanny" though I'm younger than them. One day you'll visit my own apartment, promise. Con sacrificio, Rosita

postcard.opening: Composed 15 Oct 2023 by Yusuf to Uncle, Kabul, Afghanistan.
postcard.message: Uncle, I checked out books WITHOUT fearing Taliban today! Cambridge library has more volumes than our whole city. The professor said my refugee essay should be published. Strange - bombs took our home but gave me this chance. I'll make you proud. Your scholar, Yusuf

postcard.opening: Written 05-Apr-2022 from María to Mamí, San Salvador, El Salvador.
postcard.message: I called but you weren't home. The phone card cost $10 for 3 minutes! Working 14 hours/day at the poultry plant to pay coyote debt. The foreman calls us "polleritas" - little chickens. At least real chickens don't know they'll be slaughtered, right? Joking. I'm okay. Besos, Marí

postcard.opening: Sent 20/09/2023 by Priya to Papa, Mumbai, India.
postcard.message: Today I baked gulab jamun for my American coworkers! They said "so sweet!" while drinking bitter coffee. I laughed remembering how you dip them in chai. My apartment smells like home when I cook, though the gas stove works differently here. Next year, we celebrate Diwali together, yes? Your little chef, Priya

postcard.opening: Dated 10 Dec 2022 from Jian to Wife, Chengdu, China.
postcard.message: The night shift at Amazon is cold but pays double. I wear two pairs socks like you packed. Saw a delivery driver hit by car last week - no insurance. Please don't tell mother. Only 11 more months until debt is cleared and I can return to you and Xiao. Enduring, Jian

postcard.opening: Mailed 01-Aug-2024 by Mohamed to Family, Cairo, Egypt.
postcard.message: I AM CANADIAN NOW! The judge said "Welcome home" and I cried like baby. After 7 years of taxi driving and exams, I hugged the flag. The certificate goes on wall where taxi license hung. Next summer - your visas inshallah! Start packing warm clothes. With joy, Mo

postcard.opening: Written 18th May 2023 from Elena to Sister, Bucharest, Romania.
postcard.message: Saw a gypsy violinist at the station today - played "Cântec de Leagăn" perfectly. I dropped 20 euros though can't afford it. The baby inside me kicked to the rhythm. You'll be auntie by Christmas! Florin doesn't know yet... some things are better from distance. Secretly yours, Elenuța

postcard.opening: Sent 15-Jul-2024 by Diego to Primos, Bogotá, Colombia.
postcard.message: THE TRUCK IS OURS! No more renting - "Arepas Don Miguel" is official. First customer was a homesick Venezuelan who kissed my hands. We play vallenatos loud like back home. Abuelita's recipe notebook sits by the grill like sacred text. Come visit - I'll sponsor visas! With fried hope, Diego

postcard.opening: Dated 30 Nov 2022 from Anh to Grandmother, Hanoi, Vietnam.
postcard.message: Bought my first winter coat today - puffy like marshmallow! The saleswoman said "good for -30°C" like that's normal. My fingers still freeze waiting for bus at 5AM nail salon shift. Strange to miss Hanoi's heat and motorbike smoke. I send warmer socks next month. Cold kisses, Anh

postcard.opening: Composed 01/09/2023 by Kwame to Father, Accra, Ghana.
postcard.message: The court said no. After 8 years building London's skyscrapers, I'm "illegal." They let me stay until Christmas - cruel gift. Don't sell land to pay lawyer again. Maybe God wants me home. The shame hurts worse than handcuffs they'll use. Your failure, Kwame

postcard.opening: Mailed 22 June 2024 from Layla to Parents, Damascus, Syria.
postcard.message: Married Omar yesterday in civil ceremony. No zaffeh procession, just two witnesses from refugee center. His family sends blessings from Turkey. We combined traditions - I wore blue for Syrian brides, he gave German gold ring. Strange to build love atop so much loss. Bittersweet, Layla

postcard.opening: Written 14-Feb-2023 by Pablo to Hermano, Medellín, Colombia.
postcard.message: Got Mom's face tattooed over my MS13 marks today. The artist said "She's pretty" while erasing monsters. Pain was nothing compared to crossing deserts. Now when ICE looks at me, they'll see her first. Rehabilitation starts with skin, yes? Changing, Pablito

postcard.opening: Sent 05 Jan 2025 from Nadia to Mama, Kiev, Ukraine.
postcard.message: First nursing paycheck came! Sending half for your basement apartment rent. The hospital hired me despite "accent." Patients say I have healing hands - like you always told me. Warsaw feels safer but my heart stays with you in bunkers. Come spring, I'll bring you here. Your warrior, Nadiyka

postcard.opening: Sent 15-Jun-23 from Aunt Martha to Niece Emily, Portland, OR.
postcard.message: The Arizona heat is brutal but these cacti thrive! Found a variety that blooms at night. Reminds me of your college all-nighters. How's the new job? Love, Aunt Martha

postcard.opening: Written 03/09/22 by Mr. Thompson to Book Club, Springfield Library.
postcard.message: Found this 1940s Royal at a flea market! Needs new ribbon but keys work perfectly. Shall we use it for our next meeting minutes? Regards, D. Thompson

postcard.opening: Mailed 22 Nov 2023 from Jake to Roommates, Apartment 4B.
postcard.message: Conference is boring but the seafood here is amazing! Fog rolls in at 4pm like clockwork. Don't forget to water my fern! Later, Jake

postcard.opening: Posted 08-Jul-24 by Urban Explorers Club to New Members, Chapter 17.
postcard.message: Found this beauty off Route 9! Interior stairs unsafe but view from base incredible. Next meetup Sept 10th - bring flashlights. - Pres. Carson

postcard.opening: Dated Feb 14, 2023 from Grandma Rose to Liam, College Dorm.
postcard.message: The new baker makes croissants almost as good as Paris! Saved you one in freezer for Thanksgiving. Study hard! XOXO, Grandma

postcard.opening: Sent 01 May 2024 by Uncle Pete to The Kids, Lake House.
postcard.message: Found the old railroad spur we played on as boys! Tracks rusted but still straight. Perfect for summer photo shoot. - Uncle P

postcard.opening: Written 30.10.2022 from Clock Repair to Mrs. Wilkins, 22 Maple St..
postcard.message: Your grandfather clock is ready! Chimes perfectly on the hour. Stop by before Friday. - H. Schmidt

postcard.opening: Posted 15-Apr-2023 by Garden Committee to Plot #12, Greenview Complex.
postcard.message: First tomatoes ripening! Your zucchini is overflowing - please harvest by weekend. Happy gardening!

postcard.opening: Mailed 19/08/23 from Sarah to Mom, Home.
postcard.message: Found the perfect seashell for your collection! Weather perfect except for Tuesday's storm. Home Sunday. Love you!

postcard.opening: Sent 10 Jan 2024 by Bookworm's Nook to Loyal Customers, Main St. Area.
postcard.message: Mr. Whiskers had kittens! Three tiny book lovers born in the poetry section. Come meet them! - Staff

postcard.opening: Dated 05-Sep-22 from Hiking Club to Members, Twin Peaks.
postcard.message: New trail marked on east ridge! Moderate difficulty, stunning views. Meet at 7am Saturday. - Trailmaster

postcard.opening: Written 03/03/23 by Dave to Music Buddies, Garage Studio.
postcard.message: Scored original '69 Woodstock pressings at estate sale! Listening party Friday - bring snacks. Rock on!

postcard.opening: Posted 12 Jul 2024 from Market Manager to Vendors, Downtown Plaza.
postcard.message: New location approved! Setup starts 5am August 1st. Parking passes enclosed. - M. Rodriguez

postcard.opening: Sent 22 May 2022 by Grandpa Joe to Sophie, Summer Camp.
postcard.message: Saw this rainbow and thought of you! Hope you're making friends and catching fireflies. Love, Grandpa

postcard.opening: Mailed 08-Oct-23 from Bike Shop to Repair Customers, Neighborhood.
postcard.message: Free tune-up week! Bring your bike in before winter. Limited slots available. - Two Wheels

postcard.opening: Written 29 Feb 2024 by Puzzle Club to Members, Community Center.
postcard.message: New 5000-piece challenge puzzle set up! Come work on the sky section - all blue pieces! - Club Pres.

postcard.opening: Posted 24 Dec 2023 from Jen to Neighbors, Oak Street.
postcard.message: Holiday cookies delivered to your porch! Gluten-free batch marked with blue ribbons. Merry Christmas!

postcard.opening: Sent 18/06/22 by Dad to Sam, College.
postcard.message: Caught a 12lb bass off the old pier! Released it but took photo for bragging rights. Summer break soon! - Dad

postcard.opening: Dated 01-Sep-23 from Java House to Regulars, Downtown.
postcard.message: New Ethiopian roast arrived! First cup free for September birthdays. Open mic night returns Friday. - Baristas

postcard.opening: Mailed 10 Apr 2024 by Dog Walkers to Pet Owners, Pine Ridge.
postcard.message: New agility course installed! Grand opening Saturday 9am. Biscuits for all pups! Woof!

postcard.opening: Found 18-Jul-24 from Daniel Mercer to The Reynolds Family, Formerly of 42 Maple Drive.
postcard.message: Discovered your daughter's height markings inside the closet. Left them untouched. The apple tree you planted still bears the sweetest fruit. Hope life has been kind to you all. Wishing you continued joy, Daniel (the new homeowner)

postcard.opening: Sent 10/06/25 by María Guadalupe Hernández to Escuela Primaria Rural #17, Oaxaca, Mexico.
postcard.message: Today I became Dr. Hernández! That scholarship you scraped together sent a village girl farther than any bus could. First paycheck will rebuild your leaking roof. With eternal gratitude, María

postcard.opening: Notice posted 15 Nov 2024 from Latisha Johnson, Union Steward to Third Shift Team, Midwest Auto Plant.
postcard.message: We won the safety lawsuit! New guards being installed on Press #4 tomorrow. Jamal's accident wasn't in vain. His widow asked me to thank you all for fighting. In solidarity, Latisha

postcard.opening: Scrawled 02.09.23 by Omar Al-Farsi to Captain Giovanni Russo, Italian Coast Guard.
postcard.message: You pulled 38 of us from the sea that night. My wife rests in your waters, but our daughter took her first steps on your soil today. We named her Gioia after your ship. Forever indebted, Omar

postcard.opening: Delivered 30 Mar 2025 from Officers of Precinct #42 to Sergeant Patrick O'Malley, Lakeview Cabin.
postcard.message: Your locker still smells like Irish Spring. Rookies ask about "that St. Paddy's '03 story." We kept your coffee-stained desk exactly as you left it. The fish can wait - come visit. Your brothers in blue, Diaz, Chen, and the crew

postcard.opening: Left under plate Feb 14, 2024 from Walter Brennan to Jenny Kowalski, Sunrise Diner.
postcard.message: You remembered my usual (black coffee, rye toast) on the day Margaret's lawyer served papers. That simple kindness kept a broken man going. The $100 tip is for all the times I couldn't. Gratefully, Walt from Booth 3

postcard.opening: Report dated 05-Oct-24 from James "Mac" MacAllister to Inspector Luis Gutierrez, City Safety Office.
postcard.message: Fixed every harness issue you flagged. Showed the crew your cousin's accident photos - no more complaints about safety checks. You probably saved lives this week. Stay vigilant, Mac (55th St. site)

postcard.opening: Taped to box 01/12/23 from Nurse Amy Washington to Tom and Priya Kapoor, NICU Graduates.
postcard.message: These shoes that drowned your 2-pound miracle now fit! Saw your breast milk donation in our logbook. Little Ayaan from Bed 5 is thriving because of you. Come meet your biggest fans. With admiration, Nurse Amy

postcard.opening: Smuggled 04 Aug 2024 by Carlos Mendez to VFW Post #107 Members, Detroit, MI.
postcard.message: They took my Purple Heart but not the memories of you all. I've opened "Carlos' Auto Repair" in Tijuana. Still wake at 6am for phantom PT. Tell Rodriguez I found his lighter. Until we meet again, C.

postcard.opening: Final sale 20 Jan 2025 from Samuel Pasternak to Haddonfield Literary Society, Hometown.
postcard.message: The last book sold was your childhood favorite "Charlotte's Web." The bank takes the keys tomorrow. Take whatever remains tonight - no charge. Stories deserve better than dumpsters. Keep reading, Sam

postcard.opening: Returned 11-Sep-24 from Nurse Kareem Jefferson to Sergeant Elijah Williams, VA Hospital Room 712.
postcard.message: Found these in what remained of your uniform. The blood is gone but the shrapnel dents remain - like your stubbornness. PT at 3pm. I put Army stickers on your walker. See you soon, Nurse K.

postcard.opening: Etched May 1, 2024 by The 7am Crew to New Guy from Guatemala, Home Depot Lot.
postcard.message: Left gloves for you, hermano. Your palms bled yesterday but you didn't complain. Foreman pays Fridays now, not "mañana." Small victories add up. Ask Paco about his taco truck dream. Your work family, Miguel, Raj, and the boys

postcard.opening: Unveiled 15/06/24 from Mayor Alicia Torres to Edna Williams, Route #17 Bus.
postcard.message: You drove me to school every day for 12 years. Today we named your bus stop "Edna's Corner." The seat with your sweater stays reserved. Tight lines out there! Your favorite passenger, Alicia

postcard.opening: Copied 20-Oct-24 by Leila Abadi to Judge Evelyn Woodward, Immigration Court.
postcard.message: Your signature changed everything. Yasmin starts school Monday with a pink backpack instead of hiding in bomb shelters. She wants to be a judge "like the nice lady." With profound thanks, Leila

postcard.opening: Left on desk 05 Jun 2025 from Joseph "Joey" Marino to Mr. Sean Callahan, Room 107.
postcard.message: You said algebra would save my life. It did - got me into electrician's school. Those detention slips made better references than anyone knew. I'm wiring homes for Habitat now. Your reformed troublemaker, Joey

postcard.opening: Stamped 31 Jul 2024 from Doris Whitmore (HR) to Assembly Line Team, Factory #7.
postcard.message: The robots arrive Monday. Enclosed are the cafeteria recipes - machines can't make meatloaf like ours. My 43 years here end with this note. Take care of each other. With love, Doris

postcard.opening: Finalized 05 Jan 2025 by Caseworker Mei Lin to Aniyah Carter, Foster Home #23.
postcard.message: Marcus' nightmares stopped calling you "temporary." The judge used the gold dinosaur sticker he picked. You're forever now. He insisted I send this courtroom photo. Congratulations, Mom, Mei

postcard.opening: Smuggled 10 Dec 2024 from Javier Rios to Maria & Leo (Apt 5C), Oakview Apartments.
postcard.message: They let me take nothing but this key. Please feed Gato - he likes the salmon treats. The ferns need water Sundays. If I cross back, first paycheck is yours. Your grateful neighbor, Javier

postcard.opening: Pinned 18 Mar 2024 from Nurse Priya Kapoor to Lena Petrov, 5-Year Survivor.
postcard.message: Another clear scan! The toddler you comforted during chemo starts kindergarten this fall. She calls you "Auntie Brave." Come tell her about your nursing degree! With joy, Nurse Priya

postcard.opening: Nailed 30 Sep 2024 by Union President Hank Murphy to Blackrock Miners, Last Shift.
postcard.message: Left Davy's lunch pail where the collapse happened. The coal dust in our lungs will outlast the pensions. Tell your grandkids we kept the lights on for 80 years. With headlamps high, Hank
